Hello everyone, just thought I'd add a bit of humor to this subject. Please don't take offence, it's a JOKE. If you feel the need to fight back, feel free to submit other jokes / comments. By the way, even though this joke I made up is biased, it doesn't prove what I believe:<
 
 
 
 It was the year 1909 and a navy officer (who was a Humanist) decided to search for the North Pole. He brought along a Biologist for research and a Priest just for moral support. While trekking through the middle of no-where they stumble across an igloo.
 
 The Priest exclaims:
 
 "it's a miracle!"
 
 The Humanist dismisses it saying:
 
 "don't be silly, man must have made it"
 
 Then the biologist pipes up:
 
 "wait a minute"
 
 After jotting down notes and referring to his books for about an hour he says:
 
 "yes, after scientifically analyzing the facts it's obvious to me that over a period of about 1000 years this snow shelter evolved"

A woman throws a fancy dress party, the theme being 'emotions'.
 
 That night, two men turn up at the door, both nude. One has his penis in a bowl of custard, the other has his penis jammed in a piece of fruit.
 
 The hostess, seeing them, exclaims in shock: "What on earth are you two supposed to be?"
 
 One replies: "I'm f***ing 'dis custard, and my friend has come in 'dis pear."
 
 ====================
 
 Three pregnant women sitting in a doctor's waiting room, knitting.
 
 After a while, the first puts down her knitting, rummages in her handbag, and comes out with a box of pills. She takes one, and resumes knitting.
 
 Seeing this, one of the other women asks: "What's that you're taking?"
 
 "Folic acid," she replies. "Good for the baby."
 
 A while later, the second woman puts down her knitting and fetches a box of pills from her bag. Seeing the other two women looking enquiringly at her, she explains: "Vitamins; good for the baby."
 
 All three resume knitting.
 
 Finally, the third woman puts her knitting down and extracts a box of pills from her handbag. The first woman asks what she's taking.
 
 "Thalidomide," she replies. "I can't do sleeves."
